title: Can I be a K-pop idol if I can't sing? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are blessed with good looks and looks like Asian then I guess you can. Before becoming a K-pop idol everyone have to go through extreme years of training that includes singing lessons , Dancing lessons , exercise , Diet sessions , language learning and a lot of other stuff . So their are many artist who were not gifted with these talents before but with hard work , dedication that they have to do in their training period before becoming a K-pop idol they were able to develop these skills. These extreme training periods are one of the reason why a lot of k-celebrities are all rounder , like everyone can dance good and even many actors can sing. It's easy to ask “If I can become a K-pop idol if I don't have this or that” but becoming a K-pop idol is not as easy as it seems those beautiful idols are not perfect they have flaws a lot of flaws and they have to go through a looooooooot of stuff and hardships for becoming a K-pop idol. If you are ready to sacrifice your sleep , sacrifice your fav food , sacrifice your comfort zone , and is ready to not give up no matter how many obstacles come to your way , then only you should think about becoming a K-pop idol and go for it. So first ask yourself Are you ready ? I am not trying to demotivate you just trying to show you the real world that is hard to be seen behind the limelight and beauty of K-pop . Hope this helped you.

Of course. Literally so many top groups can’t sing at all and look at where they are. Kpop is not a genre that emphasizes on proper vocal or singing, it’s mostly show and trying to get that dance over with the easiest vocals possible. Exceptions are groups like EXO, BTOB, TVXQ, Mamamoo. Fans tend to focus on ‘personalities’ and looks more than anything else. Almost all groups have some sort of choreography and the music is mostly generic, what some fans will admit and some others will pretend their biases are musically exceptional cause they wrote their own lyrics or produced a part. A lot of groups have members that are given singing parts but have no vocal training at all. I went to a group’s concert last year and the concert was mostly yelling (‘rapping’) and the singing was not even mediocre, to say the least. It was so disappointing but at least the dancing was ok. And this was what is considered a top group.

“… allowed entry…” lmao. Yes, people are allowed to become a member of a K-pop group if they don’t sing well, if that’s what you meant. As long as they can rap well, or they’re good at dancing, or both. Different companies will set different sets of standards though. There is a chance with certain companies that you can debut for only having good looks. Take a look at my wonderful ultimate bias, Kim Seokjin of BTS. He debuted because of his looks only, he had no skill in rapping, singing, or dancing at that time. But what he did was that over the years he improved himself, and now look at him! Hittin’ them high notes in Epiphany, and composing his own tracks like Tonight! <3

If you meet most of the criteria for a kpop idols (hate to be blunt but if you have visuals, can dance or rap) then you have a fair chance of becoming one… Because the whole thing about training is you improve with time and practice and there’s a LOT of practice. When you become a trainee you’re given singing, dancing and language lessons so your singing will most likely improve. This is all coming from the fact that NCT’s Lucas was solely Scouted because of his visuals… so you have a chance if you think you have the visual or may not dance skills or something

Actually, it is possible. Jin of BTS wasn’t recruited for singing, but for his looks. He actually had to take more lessons than other members. This was also another possible reason why he doesn’t get as many lines in songs. Jin has actually said he was recruited because of his visuals. So, you can become a K-Pop idol if you can’t sing.
